full_text: LAW OFFICES OF GERALD B. LEFCOURT, P.C. Ms. Lanna Belohlavek June 5, 2006 Page 7 IV. Conclusion Under the circumstances of this case a plea to felony aggravated assault is both unwarranted and presents a grave risk the client will be brandished a sex offender, bearing the attendant burdens inherent with that classification. In light of this, and the credibility issues presented by the complaining witnesses, combined with the client's two psycho-sexual evaluations and lie detector tests, we believe that at the very most, a misdemeanor plea to solicitation is appropriate. Very truly yours, Gerald B. Lefcourt 07/26/17 Page 22 of 131 Public Records Request No.: 17-295 DOJ-OGR-00030489

text_blocks.content: LAW OFFICES OF GERALD B. LEFCOURT, P.C.

Under the circumstances of this case a plea to felony aggravated assault is both unwarranted and presents a grave risk the client will be brandished a sex offender, bearing the attendant burdens inherent with that classification. In light of this, and the credibility issues presented by the complaining witnesses, combined with the client's two psycho-sexual evaluations and lie detector tests, we believe that at the very most, a misdemeanor plea to solicitation is appropriate.
07/26/17 Page 22 of 131 Public Records Request No.: 17-295

organizations: Law Offices of Gerald B. Lefcourt, P.C.

additional_notes: The document appears to be a letter from Gerald B. Lefcourt to Lanna Belohlavek, discussing a legal case and recommending a misdemeanor plea. The document is page 7 of the original letter and page 22 of a larger compilation of documents (131 pages). The document has been stamped with a public records request number.
